fields.description:
It would be great if we can have an option to define a flag in the issues on the board which changes according to the estimated Story Point x actual value.
If the issue exceeds it's estimate Story Point, it changes the flag color.
fields.summary: Change the flag based in Story Points

fields.description:
When working in a Agile Board, you can select quick filters previously created, if you select more than one quick filter, it will always add to the previous one like: assignee = rcarracedo and type = bug it will show issues that have the rcarracedo assignee and the issue type bug. But if you select two filters: type = bug and type = task, it will show no results, because the issue type can't be both bug and task at the same time.

Customer would like to have the option to change between the "AND" and "OR" operators implicit when selecting more than one quick filter.
fields.summary: Ability to change between "AND" or "OR" in quick filters

fields.description:
JIRA Admins are being confused by the [JIRA Agile 6.3 Upgrade notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+6.3+Upgrade+Notes] because they don't find the documented message: "JIRA Agile has an upgrade available" on the Manage Add-ons page. 

Also, when they see that Greenhopper shows under the available updates, they are hesitant to update it, perhaps confused by the following line in the documentation: 
bq. Go to "JIRA Agile" (not GreenHopper) in the UPM

As I'm not sure what is the actual expected behaviour, I'm filing this as a documentation update - also because updating Greenhopper to JIRA Agile 6.3, from the Available Updates section of the Manage Add-ons page works as expected.
fields.summary: Update the JIRA Agile Upgrade Notes

fields.description:
This request is about to have the total hours summed up on per column (TO DO, IN PROGRESS, DONE) as shown on the screenshot attached.

Thanks
fields.summary: Total Hours Summed up on per Column

fields.description: On an agile board, the cell looks to be designed for nearly 4 lines when 3 will likely do. This makes it difficult to view many items at once - a lot of space is wasted.
fields.summary: Agile Board - Cell height is larger than necessary, limits number of cells simultaneously viewed

fields.description:
When using the Agile boards in work mode in scrums that take place with participants in multiple regions, we often need to switch the boards to show swimlanes by assignee, or story, or Epic, in order to visualise progress and focus on blockers.  

This can't be done easily by a quick 'flip' of the swimlane view - we have to go into configuration (and only the board owner can change it) or have two identical boards which differ only by swimlane config (which seems pointless).

Can we have the ability to switch the swimlane mode outside of the config area?  This would be useful and productive in the same way that the quick filters are.
fields.summary: As a ScrumMaster I want to be able to switch swimlane modes quickly in order to support more productive scrums
it is possible to add some additional columns to the table that appears below the burndown chart?

fields.description:
Hi, I´m using JIRA Agile api to bring data from a control chart.
/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapid/charts/controlchart?"
I can process the values, but I noticed, when a issue spends more than 9999999999 milisseconds, in a state, i.e, the time returned by the api is longer than 10 digits, the time returned is zero. So, I can´t do proper calculation with this numbers, since 9999999999 corresponds approximatedly to 115 days, and I have many issues that spends more than 115 days in a state.
fields.summary: Rest API for Control Chart doesn´t return time values correctly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-9751].
  {panel}

Burn down chart: 
The legend (top right) is always blocking the graph - at the end of a sprint 
--> see example graphic attached.

Solution: -> Legend should be moveable or on click invisible etc.
fields.summary: Legend hides details in burn-down chart

fields.description:
If get almost every second change in a ticket the problem with “XSRF Security Token Missing”.
Then I need to remove the saved cookie in my Browser (Firefox) and restart Jira and than it works again for some short time…

What is the problem here?
fields.summary: Problem with "XSRF Security Token Missing"

fields.description: If a multi-line custom field is viewed in the issue detail view of a board the title of that field is rendered along side it as opposed to above it (like the description field). This cuts the viewing area by half and makes it difficult to read.
fields.summary: In issue detail view multi-line custom fields are squished

fields.description: When I have two sub tasks on the board, I am not able to drag and drop them against other issues within the same column. See the screen shot attached. There are two sub stories one under another and it is not possible to change their order.
fields.summary: Unable to reorder subtasks

fields.description:
Trying to add Priority field into Issue Detail view in Agile board.
Bu Priority field is not listed in the "Issue Detail View" tab of the board configuration screen. (please see the attached image board_config.JPG)

How can we put priority field into Issue Detail View inside the board planning screen ?
fields.summary: Feature Request: ability to add Priority field in the Detail View

fields.description:
As a board user, you currently can filter on (active) sprints, and on quick filters (pre-defined by the board-owner/manager).
I would like to be able to filter on the Epics of the board, on the Versions used in the board (Fix Versions field of issues), and on the Users (assignees) used in any catrd on the board.
These filters should always be there (for example in the menu where currently you already can expand or collapse swimlanes).
I know some of these filters things could also be 'done' by using swimlanes, but our users find swimlanes very uncomfortable.
T know these filters could be implemented in Quick Filters, but then they are not dynamic: we have to adapt them all the time new Epics, Versions or Users are used.
fields.summary: As a board user, be able to filter on Epics, Versions and Users

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Create a board
* Create an Story on this board and set Original Estimate to 5h
* Create an Epic and link the Story to this Epic
* Under Epic Panel, the Estimation for the Epic will show 5h
* Now, edit the Epic inside JIRA. Set Original Estimate to 2h
* Go back to the board, the in the Epic panel the Epic will continue to display an Estimation of 5h, and it should now display 7h
fields.summary: Estimations added to Epics are not taken under consideration on Boards

fields.description:
The prediction in the version report can be useful if team capacity would be taken into account.

Currently the prediction in the version report is based on the average speed from the beginning of the version till now. It simply assumes a constant team capacity while developping a new version. In my team, team members go on holiday, are sick, or a new person can join the team, so the team capacity is not constant.

I would like to specify the teams capacity (for example 2.4 FTE) for each week the version is in development, such that it can be used in the prediction of the version report. 
JIRA Agile could calculate the team's speed (story points/hours done per week) per FTE during development of the version. It can use this to give a proper prediction when the version is done, using the specified team capacity for the future, 

If this functionality would be present, I could also use it to report the teams progress to the customer who only cares about the release date.
I now manually make a report in excell, which takes time and is annoying.

Situation: The customer wants a new version of the software in 21 weeks (approximately 5 months). So I created a version and assigned issues to it.
When starting development of the new version, a big part of the team was on holiday, making the initial prediction way to pessimistic. Now, a few weeks later it is a bit better, but still to pessimistic (see attachment), so I can not use it.
fields.summary: As a project manager I would like to specify the teams capacity to get a useful version report prediction

fields.description:
It would be great if we could add a post function to workflow steps to change the JIRA Agile rank of a Jira task as it is transitioned through the workflow

Currently, if a task has to move from 'In Review', back to 'In Progress', the task will keep its ranking, which will make it lower in the queue than the other 'In Progress' tasks.
However, we would like to rank these tasks to the top of the backlog with a post function, so that they are at the top of the engineer's Kanban queue.

Not a dupe of GHS-749
fields.summary: Add a post function to workflows to change rank of Jira task

fields.description: This was included in earlier versions of GH, e.g. v. 6.1.3 but is missing now. Why?
fields.summary: As a user and as an admin I would like to have an indicator for the rapid board type (SCRUM, KanBan, ...)

fields.description:
I have a greenhopper scrum board. If I make a copy of it and change the filter on the copy of the board, it changes the filter on the original board. I don't think this should be the behavior. If the board is being copied, the filter should be copied, and changes should be isolated.

One thing I tried to do was create a template board that other projects could just copy and then customize, but this was not possible to do because of this shared filter issue.
fields.summary: Copied GreenHopper scrum boards should not share filter object

fields.description: Currently, you are able to to hide non working days in the burndown chart however there is no way to hide the non working days in the *Sprint burndown gadget*.
fields.summary: Sprint burndown gadget to hide non working days

fields.description:
It seems that the Column Constraint does not apply when selecting the quick filter. When 3 stories are in the status In Progress with a maximum of 2 issue counts, it turns red. However, it keeps red even after applying the quick filter which returns zero results for the status In Progress.

Before quick filter applied:
!column1.png!

After quick filter applies:
!column2.png!

The expectation would be that the red color disappear if the amount of issues/stories appear in the column is not more than max issue counts.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like the Column Constraint to apply for Quick Filter

fields.description: Boards with swimlanes are sometimes hard to read. As a board user, I would like to have an option to activate or de-activate swimlanes (like the option in the menu to expand or collapse all swimlanes).
fields.summary: As a board user, I would like to be able activate or de-activate the grouping in swimlanes

fields.description: In particular, epic link, but there may be others.
fields.summary: Subtasks should inherit greenhopper properties from their parent

fields.description: Would be good to have the same options of filtering like in filter for issue in Jira.
fields.summary: Better options of filtering on Work view.

fields.description:
Would be good to have the same options filter
like in Jira issue view. Separate for Epic ans Issues.
fields.summary: Better and separate filtering options for Epic and Issues

fields.description:
During our planning meetings after we've assigned out stories, we like to quickly look at each developer's workload before starting the sprint.  I've resorted to creating a quick filter for each developer, but it is cumbersome to have to undo a filter and select a different filter.

It would be great if all the potential assignees (users in the Developer role) would be displayed in the left area of the Scrum Planning Board and function the same way the epics and versions do.
fields.summary: Show list of assignees on the Scrum Planning Board

fields.description:
Even though an issue can be transitioned to a status in JIRA, when a user tries to transition it (using drag and drop) from one status to other, both mapped within the same column on a board, nothing happens. 

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Set up a board with two statuses mapped within a column (e.g. "Resolved" and "Closed" mapped to 'Done' column)
# Have an issue in "Resolved" status (ensure you can transition it to "Closed" status in JIRA)
# Try to drag and drop the issue from "Resolved" to "Closed"

h4. Expected Result
The issue would be successfully transitioned to "Closed"

h4. Actual Result
Nothing happens, the issue remains in "Resolved" status
fields.summary: Add ability to transition an issue (drag and drop) to another status mapped in the same column

fields.description:
As a scrum master, I'd like to be able to group tickets by project in work mode.

We run many concurrent projects from the same board. Currently we use epics for projects, but there are some significant disadvantages to that since the rest of jira, plug-ins, etc. don't really know anything about epics, but they do know about projects & versions.

(Really, I'd like to be able to create swimlanes by pretty much ANY field, and I'd like to be able to dynamically change them on the fly without going into "configure", but that seems like a significantly larger ask.)

{{original Suggestion included by Version but this is now tracked in GHS-5720}}
fields.summary: Swimlanes by project

fields.description:
Raised on behalf of a customer.

We're scheduling a Sprint with x Story Points, however due to scope change during the sprint we end up completing only y. During the sprint we change some Story Point values on the stories to account for new stories being added after the sprint has started and it's a way of indicating how much work we actually completed on the story. We work in a small company, so there is often a lot of scope change for last minute requests on work.

At the end of the sprint, we need to see how much work we *actually* completed, rather than what we committed to. The Sprint, Burndown and Velocity Report all display committed story points rather than story points after scope change.
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master / PM I want to see the actual completed Story Points at the end of a Sprint

fields.description:
Right now we have the burndown chart. 
To set it up, we have the start date and end date and then it gives us the remaining values, required daily burndown rate, etc. 

Would it be possible to set up the burndown chart differently. Meaning instead of getting the end date, can we instead input our estimated daily burndown rate and then have the gadget give us the estimated date?
fields.summary: Agile Burndown chart to give Estimated Date from estimated daily burndown rate

fields.description: The ability to have some level of tracking on Ranking changes would help provide understanding on why the Rank was changed.
fields.summary: Ability to comment on Ranking changes

fields.description: When viewing the Sprint, Version, or Epic report, there is a list of issues presented at the bottom. I expect to be able to sort this list to meet my needs. For example, on the Epic report, I will want to sort by Sprint. Other lists with columns normally allow for sorting by said columns.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to change sort order of issues in reports

fields.description:
Currently in the Kanban Board, if you have a sub-task that is in a different column from its parent issue, there is a gray ribbon above the subtask indicating its parent issue key and summary. 
This can be very tedious to view when the Kanban backlog gets bigger, since its difficult to refer to a subtask's parent issue. This gray ribbon should also act as a *link* that automatically selects the parent issue in the board. 

Note that this is not accounting the *STORIES* swimlane as some users prefer not using any swimlanes to keep the Kanban board compact.
fields.summary: Subtasks should have a link to parent issue when both subtask and parent are in different columns

fields.description: Currently _Sprint Health_ gadget shows information for running Sprints. It will be nice if it's possible to be able to view the information of the completed sprints on the same gadgets.
fields.summary: Sprint Health Gadget for completed Sprints

fields.description:
We are using agile boards for planning customer projects. We want our customer to get notifications about effective changes to the task, but with every sprint they get tons of mails about changes of the sprint and the rank field. That is very annoying. We would really appreciate a possibility to suppress notifications for these 

1) special fields
2) or during planning (like the checkbox you can use while changing multiple issues)
3) or GH at all

any of these solutions would be fine.
fields.summary: Make JIRA Software notifications less noisy

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-9705].
  {panel}

When bulk editing the Epic Link field the following error is thrown. In JIRA 6+ the error only appears in the logs. Older versions of JIRA show in the bulk edit confirmation screen.

{noformat}

fields.description:
I use Task Boards that have a view on multiple Jira projects. These Task Boards show all Sprints related info (e.g. in Sprint Reports) for the issues of those projects. When starting a new project, I want to start with a clean task board, that is a board without any historic Sprint information, only seeing the Sprints and the Issues that were managed by the board I just created. This is not possible with the current version of Greenhopper.

BTW. The only workaround for this is clearing all Sprints from all issues (including closed issues). Only in this way, my task board is clean but I also lose all historic information on issues solved in previous Sprints in previous projects.

The solution would be to only show issues and sprints that were managed under control of the new Task Board.
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master I want to be able to create a new clean taskboard so that I can start a new project without any historic Sprint data from previous projects

fields.description:
Currently GH cannot be used to schedule the Release Trains, mainly because by design you cannot assign Epics to sprints.

Tom's suggestion: 
bq. ... use the fact that Kanban boards display Epics just like any other cards to model Release Trains. The main limitation there is that of course Kanban boards don't have a concept of sprints - you would need to model it with versions or custom fields.

Please check the link for more information on how Release Trains are supposed to be used.

Note: that's not a request for implementing these Trains idenically as described there, the whole point of this epic is to make GH scale to a bigger level, so people can use it to plan macro-sprints.
fields.summary: SAFE Release Trains - Scaling GH

fields.description:
When viewing the Work page and configuring the view to Story based swim lanes, I can't see the Epic for each of the stories on the Story heading bar.  I would like to have an option to list the Epic somewhere on the bar along with the Issue ID, and Summary just like the planning page.  

Right now we have to add the Epic name to the Summary to see which Epic they are part of.  See attached.
fields.summary: As a RB user I want to see the Epic listed in the Story Swimlane.

fields.description:
Today we have the _Versions_ and the _Epics_ tabs in the left side of the Rapid Board.

It would be great if we can have an _Assignee_ tab as well, such the one in the Classic Boards.
fields.summary: Assignee tab in the Rapid Board

fields.description:
As a user I would like to be able to enter the start and end date of a sprint manually rather than being forced to use the datepicker.

When starting a new sprint or amending the start/end date of a running sprint I always have to select the date and time by clicking in the date selector popup. For the date itself this is not much of a problem, but for the time component this is a real pain as it can mean heaps of clicks to get the minutes and hours right. Instead of clicking so many times I prefer to simply enter date time.
fields.summary: Allow Manual Input for Sprint Start/End Date

fields.description: As a user, I can hide the priority field from view within both Backlog and Active sprints/Kanban board (formerly Plan Mode and Work Mode) since I don't need Priority when I already use Rank.
fields.summary: Ability to remove the priority icon from Agile boards

fields.description: As a user, I can hide the priority field from view within both Plan Mode and Work Mode since I don't need Priority when I already use Rank.
fields.summary: Hide Priority Icon

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to view Business Value and maybe other fields within the list view of the plan mode.  In the ondemand configuration, it appears the ability to edit what is displayed was/is part of the classic boards.  I'm not a fan of the classics.

While I can add BV to the Issue Detail View from the configuration, it requires me to click on the issue.  I would much rather have it listed next to "Epic", "Version" and "SP" with the other critical values that assist with planning.
fields.summary: As a user of Jira OnDemand / Greenhopper, I'd like to see Business Value in plan mode.

fields.description: When user is on agile board and has JIRA item details displayed on the right side the attempt to add comment (click [Comment])or add file ([Add File] fails to open popup. It was working well on 8/14 and before but starting 8/15 it forces user to go to full item detail page to make modifications. Please investigate and fix the workflow since it's really inconvenient. Thank you.
fields.summary: Popups are blocked when user attempts to add comments and such from agile board
Epic Link value not displayed in Bulk Edit final screen

fields.description: As a planner, I want to be able to see how much work is assigned to different specialists (or groups of specialists) on my team, so I can balance the workload accordingly.
fields.summary: Support preassigning work to specialists

fields.description:
Currently there is no feature to sort the epics on the scrumboard. Every time when i drag story to attach to the epic, i need to keep keep scrolling through the epics to find the right one. I can do this manually when the list of epics is small but not when the list grows too long.

Would be good if the epics are sorted.
fields.summary: Ability to sort Epics alphabetically on the scrumboard

fields.description:
https://developer.atlassian.com/design/latest/colors.html says
"Don't rely on color alone to convey state or meaning". The selected issue in GH boards is indicated by color only.

One other way to communicate this information might be for GH to make the border of the card thicker? The same problem exists with the colors of selected and unselected flagged issues.

This was also discussed at  http://stackoverflow.com/questions/18241838/how-do-i-change-color-of-selected-issue-in-greenhopper-planning-board/18263886#18263886
fields.summary: Selected issue is marked using color only

fields.description: As an admin, I'd like the ability to limit the number of issues on rows and/or columns in Kanban board
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like the ability to limit the number of issues on rows and/or columns in Kanban board

fields.description: Currently when using swimlanes based on queries, it's only possible to "ORDER BY" *rank*. If we try to use another value on the "ORDER BY" clause such as priority, issue type, etc. It still orders by rank. It would be great if we could use another value to order the issues.
fields.summary: Improve "ORDER BY" feature when using swimlanes based on queries

fields.description:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Configuring+Swimlanes

It would be great if we could include on the documentation that is only possible to "ORDER BY" *rank* when using swimlanes based on queries. If we try to use another value on the "ORDER BY" clause such as priority, issue type, etc. It still orders by rank.
fields.summary: Edit "Configuring Swimlanes" documentation

fields.description:
f.e. 
there is one team of five programmers. they all are working for more than one project.

programmer 1 --> project 1 and project 2
programmer 2 --> project 2 and project 3
programmer 3 --> project 1 and project 3
programmer 4 --> project 3
programmer 5 --> project 1, project 2 and project 3

a good overview would be a hour chart per sprint across this projects (please take a look at the attachment).
fields.summary: Hour chart across projects and users

fields.description:
The [documentation for the Sprint Health Gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+the+Sprint+Health+Gadget] currently doesn't explain the logic behind the scope change. It appears to be an approximate percentage of plus or minus change in the total story points of a sprint, but doesn't reflect any change when you simply delete story points or replace the value with a blank in any tasks. 

Basically, users are confused about the logic of this calculation, without any clear documentaion on it.
fields.summary: Document the 'Scope Change' calculation logic

fields.description: As of now, the Version Report calculates predicted release dates only after 10% of work in a Version is done. Some users would want to see them from the very start; it would be handy to add an option allowing them to see that - with a warning that the estimation is less reliable.
fields.summary: As a project manager, I want to see the predictions in the Version Report before 10% of work is completed

fields.description:
The current behavior of this is that when a new issue is created in plan mode, it will be created under the currently highlighted issue. If no issues are selected, then the issue will be created on top of the backlog. 

This behavior can cause some inconvenience and confusion, as users are sometimes not aware of where they are highlighting when creating an issue, or not even highlighting any issue at all. They might experience some confusion looking for their issues at that time.

It would be great if there was an option or configuration that would enable the user to choose whether to place all newly created issues at the bottom of the backlog, or to use the current behavior.
fields.summary: On plan mode place newly created issues at the bottom

fields.description: Was on EACJ.
fields.summary: Command clicked on "view on board" and got a broken dialog I couldn't get out off.

fields.description:
You probably remember this form us talking about it Tom, but we have two projects on JAC, CONF - external tickets that customers can see, and CONFDEV for our internal development tasks.

Sometimes we pull CONF tickets directly into our board to manage as alongside the CONFDEV tickets in the backlog and sprints.

I'd always assumed that when we did this, customers didn't see the noise of what was happening in Greenhopper, but seems they do (not sure if it's a recent change or just hasn't been mentioned before?).

The screenshots attached show what I saw as a logged out user, and the comment there highlights how this is a big confusing. Seems like that data should only show up if you actually have permissions to view the rapid board it's coming from?
fields.summary: "Agile" data shouldn't show to users who can't view that board

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-9675].
  {panel}

It would be great if we could change the order of the statuses in a particular column, in work mode.

Consider the following scenario:

Column 1, 2 , and 3
Column 1 has status "Open" and "Reopened"
Column 2 has status "In Progress"
Column 3 has status "Resolved" and "Closed"

When transitioning something from Column 2 to Column 3, dragging the issue and hovering over column 3, "Resolved" is displayed on top and "Closed" on bottom. However, if we change this configuration in to display the contrary (Resolved = bottom, Closed = top) and go back to the board, it doesn't obey the configured order - it always seem to display the columns on a pre-defined order.
fields.summary: Ability to order statuses within columns

fields.description:
When viewing a scrum board.

I would like to know the estimate REMAINING for an Epic and for a Version.

Estimate remaining ...200hrs
fields.summary: Scrum board summary for Versions Epics to include Estimate remaining

fields.description:
In greenhoper manageboards the boards  are sorting by board name.
is it posible to sorting it by owner ?
thanks in advance.
fields.summary: adding ability of board sorting by owner in manage boards

fields.description:
As a Project Manager I need to see the Remaining Estimation directly in the Plan Mode of my Scrum Board.

Currently there is only the original estimation. I would like to see the remaining estimation directly beside the original estimation (directly beside the 2d / 5h in the attached screenshot).

Of course I know that I can see the remaining estimation of each story if I click on a story. As well do I know that the remaining estimations of all stories within a sprint are cumulated.

I would really love to see this feature in further versions - as well would the customers of //SEIBERT/MEDIA love to see this feature.
fields.summary: As a Project Manager I need to see the Remaining Estimation directly in the Plan Mode of my Scrum Board.

fields.description:
As a Project Manager I need to change the sequence of my planned Sprints in the Plan-Mode of the Scrum Board.

This is really important for me because I wish to create sprints in the far future and break them down to smaller planned sprints when time goes on.

i.e:
* Sprint KW1-KW2 2014
* Sprint KW3-KW4 2014
* Sprint February 2014
* Sprint March 2014
* Sprint Quartal 2 2014
* Sprint Quartal 3 2014
* Sprint Quartal 4 2014

Many of the customers of //SEIBERT/MEDIA wish to have this feature in order to be able to plan the tasks continuously - as a rolling plan. I would love to have this feature as well. I really hope that you are going to implement it in the near future because it allows project manager to use the agile board even for the more "classic" project management which still many of our customers love. ;-) Even for the Agile Planning this feature would bring a lot of advantages.

Please don't hesitate to contact me for any questions. I would really love to see this feature! 

Cheers
Björn Frauen
fields.summary: As a Project Manager I need to change the sequence of my planned Sprints in the Plan-Mode of the Scrum Board.

fields.description:
Customers (or a representative) raise User Stories in a Customer Project. The implementation for these User Stories are then implemented against the necessary component or components that make up the Customers Product by way of a task that addresses the User Story. Each of these components has it's own project in our Jira instance. 

Currently it is hard to see the tasks that need to be done (Sprint Backlog). A user has to open up the User Story, or use a custom filter.

We would like to see tasks linked by "addresses" appear under the User Story on the Rapid Board, much like tasks do.
fields.summary: As a Scrum Dev Team Member I want to see all tasks that are linked to a User Story by relationship 'addresses' on the Rapid Board so that I can view and progress the tasks needed to be completed across various projects in order to satisfy the User Story.

fields.description:
I have my Scrumboard arranged into swimlanes. I thought (hoped) that "Base swimlanes on" - Stories would created a swimlane for each story (it does) and in this show every issue connected to that story (except epics) (it doesn't).

I qwant to arrange swimlanes by story I can see at any time the state of every issue connected to a story.
This enables me to easily see exactly what work is left to do to complete each story, and therefore what are we likely/actually going to deliver this sprint.

This helps management to maintain stakeholder expectations.

For example:

I have multiple stories in a sprint. Each story contains acceptance criteria & enough info for devs to do work. Some additional dev/qa tasks may be created and linked to the story (we don't use sub-tasks historically) with link type 'related to', or maybe even 'blocks')

Bugs for each story will be created during the sprint. These will be linked to the story (with link types being 'found while testing', or possibly, 'blocks').

I want the bugs, tasks, sub-tasks etc. related to a story to be visible in the swimlane for that story.

The ability to do this in a lightweight manner important. Having to manually set up and maintain a bunch of JQL queries (one per story) in order to get this view is laborious if we have 15 stories every sprint, and prone to error since it's a tedious manual task.

I was very happy to see Story apear in the Group By list, but disappointed that it seems to only recognise the story itself and sub-tasks as belonging to a story (and only if the story actually has sub-tasks - which ours don't). Everything else gets booted out into the big generic pile of everything else.

Currently we have to set up a query like this for each story:

issuekey= StoryID1234 or ISSUE IN linkedIssues("StoryID1234")

It would make life easier if the setting "Base swimlanes on" - Stories actually enabled this automagically.
fields.summary: Enable Scrumboard's "Base swimlanes on: Stories" option to automatically group all associated issues in the story's swimlane

fields.description:
Currently, there are some users that is working on a not "right click" friendly environment that needs more effort to conduct the task available on the right click menu on GreenHopper.

Example for restricted right click environment:
{quote}
* Browser Security constraints forbidding hiding of browser functionality
* Users not having a 2nd mouse button at all (namely Apple users)
* Conflicts with Browser addons.
{quote}

Furthermore, the right click feature is not readily known to most of the users.

Customers has some good suggestions to set as an alternative on the right-click menu, which is Mouse-Over Drop Down Menu.

Once the mouse is hovering on top of a flag or symbol on an issue at plan/work rapidboard. The menu will drop down providing accessibility to the menu context.
fields.summary: Provide Mouse-Over Drop Down Menu as Alternative to Right-Click

fields.description:
This problem comes up during multiple sprint planning across same projects. Users would like to be prompted before GreenHopper guesses what sprint name they'd like.

Eg:
# Create a scrum board for "Project 1", and "Project 2" called "One"
# Create another scrum board for just "Project 1" called "Two"
# Go to board "One", create a sprint called "Asterix" and start it
# Go to board "Two", create a new sprint - it will be auto named "Asterix 2"

Instead 4. should prompt the user what to call the sprint if it's being planned on a different board.

It is understood that once the sprint has been triggered to start it prompts the user to name it then along with the sprint start and end dates.
fields.summary: As a Sprint Planner I want to be prompted for the new name of my sprint (problems with multiple boards)

fields.description:
We found a UI situation where GreenHopper encourages user error. Looking at the Rapid Board with an issue selected, there is a "gear" icon located at the top right corner of the screen with a pulldown menu with an option to "Delete" the issue. At the same time, there is another "gear" icon with a pulldown menu with another "Delete" option right above this one, however this is to delete the entire Board you are viewing.

This can be easily overlooked and in a simple process of deleting issues from the Rapid Board, users can hit the wrong
"gear" icon, unintentionally deleting the entire board instead of one issue - plus the flow to delete the issue and the board look very similar.

!rapid_board.png!

Since the Rapid Board delete operation destroys a lot of data in an unretrievable way - this is really concerning - even though it's a user error.
fields.summary: Confusion between deleting an entire board and one issue

fields.description:
Same as for the parent issue. 
I got a Kanban board where I mapped the swimlanes to sprint using a query
"gh.sprint.customfield.default.name" =iter8
where iter8 is the name of the sprint i have created in my GH Scrum board.

It looks awesome at first glance! but I cannot move things between swimlanes (sprints)
fields.summary: Kanban - Cannot move issue from one sprint to another

fields.description: As an administrator, I want to be able to configure cards in rapid board, work mode, so I can add/delete what's displayed, including (and especially) custom fields.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I want to be able to configure cards in rapid board work mode

fields.description: it would be good highlight subtasks of selected story on the board ;)
fields.summary: highligh subtasks
Edit "Using GreenHopper Simplified Workflow" documentation

fields.description:
Greetings to Atlassian! :),

we are about to use amazing GreenHopper, version 6.2.4.1 +Rapid board+ (picture no.4).

In rapid board view when managing Epics there is an option in drop down menu to "Mark as done" (picture no.4.). 
In the same view we would like to have the similar option to close a +Version+ via drop down menu (picture no.3). 

The expected result is that the issue is released when marked as done = released. Is there any option how to set this up? Is there something I've missed during configuration?

I wonder why is not possible to release version (picture no.2) from default as it is in classic view (picture no.1).

We know that there exist options to plan/release versions via managing project view or Kanban board. But we'd especially appreciate to have this option on Rapid Board. Switching between 3 views is illogical, ineffective and and is easy to get lost.

Thanks a lot for consideration of this improvement!

Cheers,
Lenka
fields.summary: Mark Version as Done directly on Rapid board
Allow various filters (and multiple versions) in the Version Report

fields.description:
Compared to Classic Board, where assignee can be modified on the card itself, the Rapid Board does not have such feature. With that said, changing assignee could only be done from the issue itself, or the issue detail view on Plan Mode. 

This change impacts users that are migrating from Classic Board into Rapid Board.
fields.summary: Ability to change assignee in-place on Rapid Board
If new issue is created the "X days in this column" marker is at full length

fields.description:
My user has 13 tasks and I can only move two into "in progress" the rest I can only drag to "Closed" or "resolved" -- the user can drag them into In Progress. I'm the admin/PM so I need to be able to do this. And on our first sprint I could. 

The board is TodaysGardenCenter in our Agile if you could have a look.
fields.summary: Cannot drag a users Open items into "In Progress"

fields.description:
I as a Product Owner or Scrum Master want to see a report generated by Greenhopper/JIRA Agile which shows the projected completion for the current backlog items so that I can better understand what the overall project status is today.


Further thoughts:
- able to select which epics to include as "total backlog"
- calculation based on story points
- configurable average velocity (how many or which past sprints to consider for average)
- utilize average velocity to calculate projected completion
- show how many sprints until completed
- show optimistic and pessimistic line
- configurable optimistic and pessimistic calculation (percentage)


I'm doing this today in Excel based on data I'm extracting out of JIRA.
This is the most important chart for our project and helps everybody involved to better understand where we at and take actions early to influence the project for the better.

Attaching an image of the chart I'm creating in Excel at the moment.
fields.summary: Line chart for projected backlog completion with optimistic and pessimistic

and license is not applied.

fields.description:
I have a custom field which derives from *AbstractMultiCFType* and that cannot be displayed in the Issue Detail View of the Plan and Work Modes. Looking at the GH code, in the _DetailViewFieldConfigurationServiceImpl_ class, it shows that only the following classes or classes which derives from them are supported:


* GenericTextCFType
* NumberCFType
* DateCFType
* DateTimeCFType
* UserCFType
* MultiUserCFType
* MultiGroupCFType
* LabelsCFType
* SelectCFType
* MultiSelectCFType
* VersionCFType
* CascadingSelectCFType
* EpicLinkCFType

It seems that you do not support your own base classes and many custom fields do derive from the base classes. Please at least support the *AbstractMultiCFType* as the MultiSelectCFType derives directly from it.
fields.summary: As a developer, I want the Issue Detail View in the plan and work mode to support the different JIRA custom field abstract classes so that my own custom field can be displayed

fields.description:
On the plan mode of the boards, when you select an Epic or a Version, the Sprints and backlog hide the issues that don't belong to that particular Epic or Version, however, if there is a Sprint with no issues, it is still displayed.

It would be useful if when an give Epic or Version is selected, Sprints that don't contain any issues (or don't contain any issues associated to the Epic or Version) were hidden too.
fields.summary: Hide Sprints that have 0 issues when selecting an Epic or a Version

fields.description: It would be good to be able to easily watch an issue using a button or link the detail view, so that when people are browsing the backlog (plan view) or the work view they can easily choose to watch an issue that they are interested in.
fields.summary: Be able to watch an issue from the detail view on the agile boards

fields.description:
Provide a distribution / histogram chart for the cycle / lead time data, with bin size control and moment markers.

Acceptance Criteria:

* A. Provide histrogram chart w/ left vertical axis for frequency, and horizontal axis for cycle / lead time value bins.
* B. Show frequencies of data in aggregated bins as vertical bars (all juxtaposed).
* C. Provide control over bin size, with option for "auto" (smart built-in dynamic).
* D. Provide date range slider controls to filter data (just like Control Chart).
* E. Show colour-coded vertical line / marker for Geometric Mean, per a view-control checkbox.
* F. Show a colour-coded vertical line / marker for Geometric Median, per a view-control checkbox.
* G. Show two colour-coded vertical lines / markers for Geometric Standard Deviation above & below Geometric Mean, per a view-control checkbox.
* H. Show Lognormal probability density function (PDF) curve (fitted on same left vertical axis scale), per a view-control checkbox.
* I. Show Lognormal cumulative distribution function (CDF) curve (on new right vertical axis, with 0 to 100% scale), per a view-control checkbox.
* J. In summary footer, show Sample Size ("n"), Geometric Mean, Geometric Median, Geometric Standard Deviation, Min, Max.
* K. In summary footer, show Prediction Confidence Bound, with adjustable confidence level. (E.g., 95% confident that next work item will be complete within 15 days.)

Notes:
* Cycle / lead time is reasonably modelled with Lognormal distribution (or others), not likely Normal (as also evidenced by the existing logarithmic scale on the Control Chart's vertical axis).
* The Lognormal moments are the Geometric Mean & Geometric Standard Deviation.
fields.summary: Report - Provide chart for Cycle / Lead Time Distribution

fields.description:
Repro:
# Goto Rapidboard for project (which has at least two Resolved issues).
# Open Control Chart (Report tab).

Expected:
* A. Chart should show horizontal line using Geometric Mean.
* B. Summary footer data should show Geometric Mean & Geometric Standard Deviation.

Actual:
* A. Chart shows horizontal line using Arithmetic Mean.
* B. Summary footer data shows Mean (Arithmetic) & Standard Deviation (Arithmetic).

Justification:
* Cycle/Lead time is reasonably modelled with Lognormal distribution (or others), not likely Normal (as also evidenced by the existing logarithmic scale on the Control Chart's vertical axis).
* The Lognormal moments are the Geometric Mean & Geometric Standard Deviation.
fields.summary: Report - Control Chart could be using more appropriate Mean & Standard Deviation

fields.description:
After moving an issue on the board the board is refreshed by calling {{xboard/work/allData.json}}. On our production instance this takes 6 seconds. Updating the issue is relatively quick, refreshing the board data is not.

This is down to {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lucene.ChangeHistorySearchHelper#findChangeLogFilter}}. Specifically, computing the cross-references from two queries, one of which may contain up to half a million issues, is very slow. I'm sure there is a quicker way, even if it's just checking the permission for each issue retrieved from the change history index.

As a workaround I am just disabling loading the days in column data in {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.list.RapidIssueEntryQueryServiceImpl#collectWorkModeIssues}}, which makes things passably fast.

h3. Areas of JIRA Agile Affected

* Generating JIRA Agile charts - notably Burndown, Cumulative Flow Diagram & Control Chart.
* Loading days in column for a list of issues (workaround to disable this in GHS-10520).

h3. Workaround for Work Sub-Filter

This is fixed in JIRA 6.3.1 as tracked in JRA-38883, so this workaround will only apply for previous versions of JIRA.

It's possible that on larger instances the default work sub-filter may be causing performance issues of its own. This is not related to {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lucene.ChangeHistorySearchHelper}} however does present with similar symptoms. Specifically, the [work sub-filter|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Configuring+Filters#ConfiguringFilters-AddingaSub-FilterforWorkmode] default is:

{noformat}
fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() OR fixVersion is EMPTY
{noformat}

This {{unreleasedVersions()}} JQL may be slow for larger instances that process a large number of projects, as it goes through all of them to find out which versions are relevant. This can be sped up by specifying a list of projects _that are only relevant to the JIRA Agile board being used_. For example if we wanted to only return issues for projects GHS and JRA (because they are in the board filter), we would use the following:

{noformat}
fixVersion in unreleasedVersions(GHS,JRA) OR fixVersion is EMPTY
{noformat}

Please make the above changes and verify if the boards are faster to render or not. If they are faster, it implies the {{unreleasedVersions()}} was slow to process due to the large number of projects. If it does not it would indicate that the {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lucene.ChangeHistorySearchHelper}} is the cause of slowness.

It's possible that both {{unreleasedVersions()}} and {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lucene.ChangeHistorySearchHelper}} are slow to process and this workaround only addresses one part of the problem.

fields.description:
Hey guys,
What is all of this whitespace for in GreenHopper Work Mode?

At any point in time Users are juggling dozens of open tasks.  And Greenhopper seems to make the scroll unnecessarily.   It seems like I could easily fit almost twice as many issues on my screen at any one time as GreenHopper displays to me. 

Because of this whitespace waste problem, I, as a user, use ToDo, Inprogress, and Done filters in JIRA on my JIRA dashboard to display my active work.  I lose drag-n-drop but the screen-density is easily worth the trade.  

Is there a reason for this wasted space that I'm missing?

fields.description:
I find that one of the most useful tools for our software development team is the Version Report chart.  Since the addition of this one chart, we're able to much more accurately forecast the completion of a release and extremely accurately communicate the effect of scope creep on our completion date.  We have been able to determine when it's necessary to add resources to a project and communicate to upper management exactly why they need to make a priority decision on all open projects due to release schedules.

However, in order to do this, we currently create our own trend lines with a sheet of paper held up to the monitor or projector.  I've attached a screenshot that explains why this is necessary.

First off, being able to annotate this graph as I've done in this screenshot would prove invaluable for project status reports as well as "lessons learned" post-project analysis.  I'm thinking GreenHopper stores as many points on the graph as is requested as well as an annotation for each.  These points are stored per version tracked in GreenHopper.

I feel like the "project start" date should show the entire progression (graph) of a project.  However, there needs to be an option for a progression line start date separate from the project start date, as the June re-specification and reallocation of developers to the project requires a new velocity trend line.  I already did this in March, and have been considering doing it again, but if I do this, the new graph loses the historical nature as annotated in the screenshot.

Another cool idea is a "scope creep trend line".  I just noticed today that even back all the way until early mid-april, our scope creep has been extremely linear.  This, combined with current (recent) velocity could possibly create a "true" completion date where the two lines I drew intersect?

One thing I didn't show on the graph was the ability to speculate on an increased velocity over your current velocity.  This could have been used after the spec redesign in late June and the addition of more developers to the project.  I'm thinking a box on the right that says "Speculate an additional X story points per week".  This would cause the velocity trend line slope to increase starting today, causing an upward kink in the velocity trend line with an adjusted final completion date.

I know this is a huge request, but I feel like this adds a significant amount of benefit to an already great feature.  These new features will hugely help us when communicating outside our group and committing to release dates.
fields.summary: As an agile user, I would like the option to change the predicted completion date based upon recent velocity
Create Version dialog date picker inconsistent - cannot edit date in input
